criteria.name: Trust & Communication
criteria.description: You can have hard conversations with them. They say what they think. They do what they say. You'd be comfortable giving them access to the bank account.

criteria.name: Shared Vision
criteria.description: They get that Reckn is a decision engine, not a point solution. Excited about the problem. Aligned on what kind of company you want to build and how you want to build it.

criteria.name: Can Sell
criteria.description: Capable of GTM. Experience level is secondary. Comfortable talking to strangers, pitching, handling objections, and asking for money.

criteria.name: Figures Things Out
criteria.description: Scrappy > credentialed. Will learn what they don't know. Doesn't wait to be told what to do. Has solved hard problems before.

criteria.name: Full-Time Committed
criteria.description: Binary. In or out. No other startup, no consulting on the side. Available now and willing to work for equity.

criteria.name: Startup Experience
criteria.description: Nice to have. Not predictive. Has worked at an early-stage company or started something before.

reasoning: Trust & Communication is foundation - everything else fails without it. Shared Vision at equal weight because they need to understand Reckn is a decision engine, not a point solution. Sales capability matters but experience level is secondary. Scrappy beats credentials. Commitment is binary. Startup experience is nice but not predictive.
